alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Lafayette; St. Martin; Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 5:40PM CDT until April 06 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lafayette Parish in south central Louisiana... Southeastern Acadia Parish in southwestern Louisiana... Northeastern Vermilion Parish in southwestern Louisiana... Western St. Martin Parish in south central Louisiana... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 540 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Indian Bayou, or 8 miles south of Rayne, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Scott, Carencro, Broussard, Youngsville, Duson, Maurice, Indian Bayou, Ridge and Milton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 92 and 107. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 7. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
